Text.Value: Perhaps not the thing you'll be remembered for, but a fine quality nonetheless. Adds a certain mystique, I think.
Oh, not long at all. I've rather a good memory for faces, and I've been sketching yours since my return.
Please, take it in for a moment. It's not every day one's face is preserved for posterity.
I'll need a break from the city, of course. Let things blow over a bit, shall we say?
A tad... alliterative for my tastes, but who am I to judge?
You made Lady Jannath sound like a monster.
Let's not overcomplicate things. 'Portrait of an Adventurer.' is fine.
My canvas is ready. Are you?
Certainly the defender of artists. A perfect title.
Yes, let's do it.
Wonderful. Stand yourself just there and -

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easel
EditorData.NodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easel

Text.Value: I may have used some artistic licence in describing her to you, but make no mistake - her brow definitely twitched when I told her about Kerri.
Here he is - the hero of the hour.
Here she is - the hero of the hour.
Here they are - the hero of the hour.
Not forever, of course - I still owe you a portrait, and I intend to deliver on my promise! But first, I need to rediscover my inspiration.
Where will you go?
Heroic and modest. Then this shall be simply 'The Hero of Baldur's Gate'. A title I don't doubt you'll earn in due course.
My brushes are oiled, the canvas prepped, and you...

EditorData.NodeContext: Pumped, enthusiastic.  Struggling to find a polite word for what the player is wearing.

Text.Value: How long is this going to take?
No, no, no. Of course not. And as an artist, I want to capture your true essence in this portrait - bloodstains and all.
There's something wrong with what I'm wearing?
You can't just leave. You owe me a portrait.
Of course. Whenever you're ready.
'The Ghost Whisperer'.
Call it whatever you want. I'm only going to sell it.
Somehow I doubt that.
And - voila! All it needs now is a name. Something to capture the spirit in which it was created.
I'm happy as I am.
I'd rather my name weren't on it, to be quite honest.
A very traditional choice. Perfect for such a dignified hero as yourself.
Actually, I need a moment to freshen up.
Well, you're comfortable. That's the main thing. So, shall we begin?
But a true artist embraces his suffering. No doubt I'll be the finer painter for it. Eventually.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not convinced by his own argument

Text.Value: How about you just make sure I look good?
You are? Ah. In that case, perhaps it's best left untitled.
Not just yet.
I seem to have rather a habit of overreacting. Still, such passion is where we find the most potent fuel for our creativity, is it not?
Ready as I'll ever be.
Well, every artist has their critics. Yours is an opinion I will at least bear in mind, given our shared adventures.
Nothing could be simpler. Let's begin, shall we?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easel
EditorData.NodeContext: Oskar gestures for the player to adopt their pose for the portrait, then disappears behind his easel

Text.Value: 'Skald Supreme, Orator Extraordinaire, Master of Modesty'.
I'm going to take some time and reinvent myself - find a new source of inspiration.
I just need to add the final touches, capture that unique twinkle in your eye. So, are you ready?
I think I'll try my hand at landscape painting. I've heard the Chult Peninsula has the most splendid sunsets.
Of course, if you do want to freshen up first, I'm more than happy to wait. After all, it will be seen by generations to come.
'The Mighty Defender of the Arts'.
Truly my finest work yet.

EditorData.NodeContext: blown away by his own genius

Text.Value: Take as long as you need.
Ah. My friend. I'm sorry I dragged you into this unpleasantness. Hardly the way I hoped we would be reunited.
On second thoughts, I might need a moment...
And one day, you shall have it. But I feel this particular phase of my artistic career has come to an unnatural conclusion, if you will.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'unnatural' playing on natural, has an air of finality

Text.Value: If you came to ask about your portrait, I'm afraid it will have to wait.
Remember the name Oskar Fevras. It will be back on society's lips in no time.

Synopsis: Dialog when Oskar is in his atelier, waiting to make a portrait for the player.
